Good Week, Bad Week

By James Bithell

The <em>Nouse</em> Sport team take a light-hearted look back at the sporting action from across campus over the last week

Week Four: Sporting news in brief

We take a snappy look at some of the sports news going around campus this week

Halifax triumph in One Day Ultimate Frisbee Tournament

Halifax College won the first One Day Tournament of the year, beating five other colleges in the ultimate frisbee tournament

York women's hockey firsts in stalemate

In their first outing of the season, the women's hockey first team played out a goalless draw against a strong Sheffield Hallam side.

Women's firsts sail to victory against rivals

The York women's football firsts started their season in an emphatic style, beating local rivals York St John 3-0.

Men's rugby firsts suffer second consecutive defeat

In their second match of the season, the men's rugby first team suffered defeat at the hands of Durham University seconds.

UYAFC thirds second-best in curtain raiser

Newly-promoted York men's thirds were left to rue missed chances after a late penalty handed Teesside a 1-0 win

York football seconds defeated on opening day

York men's football seconds began life in Division Four with a 3-1 defeat against Durham seconds at home on Wednesday

Halifax ease to victory over Goodricke

Last year's College Cup winners, Halifax, started their campaign in this term's Revolution Premier Division in style with a 3-1 victory over Goodricke

Langwith snatch draw with last-gasp equaliser

Langwith and Alcuin shared the points in their first outing of the new campaign, as the Hes East side snatched a draw at the death

Halifax dominate to win league opener

Halifax recorded a comfortable victory over Goodricke in the Tent as college netball gets underway for the term

James snatch scrappy victory over Vanbrugh

James Firsts re-affirmed their title credentials on Sunday as they got their Revolution Premier League campaign off to a winning start with a 2-1 victory over Vanbrugh

From the 22: Welcome to York

Beth Jakubowski talks about taking part in sport at York for the benefit of Freshers who have just joined the University

Lacrossing the divide

As the new season draws ever-closer, Claire Thomas, University of York Lacrosse Club President, talks to Jamie Summers about the changing nature of the club and campaign ahead.
